COMEDK UGET is a common entrance test held at the national level for admission to around 190 unaided private engineering colleges in Karnataka.
The exam is usually conducted in May. It consists of 180 questions (60 each from Physics, Chemistry, Maths) to be answered in 3 hours.
There are over 190 colleges accepting COMEDK scores. You can view the top colleges in the 'Colleges' tab on this website.
Some top colleges include RVCE, BMSCE, MSRIT, and DSCE. Check the 'Colleges' section for a full list.
Cutoffs vary by college, branch, and category. You can use our 'Predictor' tool to check which colleges you are eligible for based on your rank.
Cutoffs change every year. It's best to check the 'Predictor' page to get an idea based on previous years' trends.
Your rank is determined by your score in the COMEDK UGET exam. Higher score leads to a lower (better) rank.
A rank below 5000 is generally considered very good for top colleges and branches.
Counselling usually happens in 3 rounds. You need to register online, upload documents, fill choices, and lock them.
Keep an eye on the official COMEDK website for counselling schedules and notifications.
Common documents required are Admit Card, Rank Card, 10th/12th Marks Cards, ID Proof, Study Certificate, etc.
Ensure you have original documents and multiple sets of attested photocopies.
The tuition fee for COMEDK colleges is generally around 2-2.5 Lakhs per annum, but it varies by college.
Apart from tuition fees, there might be other college fees and hostel fees.
To use the predictor, go to the 'Predictor' page, enter your rank, select your preferred branches, and click 'Predict Colleges'.
The predictor uses past year data to estimate your chances. Give it a try!
